text: J Nyi Nyi (; ; 12 December 1953 – 31 March 2025) was a Burmese singer and musician. He was known for his contributions to Myanmar's pop music. From the 1970s until his death in 2025, he helped shape modern Burmese pop music by mixing traditional sounds with modern styles. He released many albums and remained a well-known figure in Myanmar’s music industry. == Early life and education == J Nyi Nyi was born on 12 December 1953 in Wakema Township, Burma (now Myanmar). He was interested in music from a young age. He studied the arts and music, which helped him become a singer and songwriter. == Career == J Nyi Nyi started his music career in the 1970s and became one of Myanmar's top pop singers. His unique voice and style made him popular. In the 1980s, he helped modernize Burmese pop music by combining traditional Burmese music with new pop sounds. == Discography == === Studio albums === # မှတ်တိုင်များ (1992) # A Yate Ka Lay (2002) === Singles === # Lu Bawa (2024) == Personal life == J Nyi Nyi got married in 1999. He lived in Yangon, Myanmar, until he passed away. == Death == J Nyi Nyi died on 31 March 2025 at the age of 72. The cause of his death is unknown. == Legacy == J Nyi Nyi is remembered as an important singer in Myanmar. His ability to mix modern and traditional music influenced many young artists in Myanmar. == References == Category:1953 births Category:2025 deaths Category:20th-century Burmese musicians Category:21st- century Burmese musicians Category:Burmese singers Category:Burmese singer- songwriters Category:Pop singers Category:People from Yangon Category:Pages created with the Article Wizard from 2025 Category:20th-century singers Category:21st-century singers
title: J Nyi Nyi
